notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.8 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 115.8.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Out-of-bounds memory read in networking channels (CVE-2024-1546)

* Mozilla: Alert dialog could have been spoofed on another site (CVE-2024-1547)

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 123, Firefox ESR 115.8, and Thunderbird 115.8 (CVE-2024-1553)

* Mozilla: Fullscreen Notification could have been hidden by select element (CVE-2024-1548)

* Mozilla: Custom cursor could obscure the permission dialog (CVE-2024-1549)

* Mozilla: Mouse cursor re-positioned unexpectedly could have led to unintended permission grants (CVE-2024-1550)

* Mozilla: Multipart HTTP Responses would accept the Set-Cookie header in response parts (CVE-2024-1551)

* Mozilla: Incorrect code generation on 32-bit ARM devices (CVE-2024-1552)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

When storing and re-accessing data on a networking channel, the length of buffers may have been confused, resulting in an out-of-bounds memory read.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Out-of-bounds memory read in networking channels
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Out-of-bounds memory read in networking channels

cwe.name: The UI Performs the Wrong Action

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Through a series of API calls and redirects, an attacker-controlled alert dialog could have been displayed on another website (with the victim website's URL shown).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Alert dialog could have been spoofed on another site

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

A website could have obscured the fullscreen notification by using a dropdown select input element. This could have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Fullscreen Notification could have been hidden by select element

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

If a website set a large custom cursor, portions of the cursor could have overlapped with the permission dialog, potentially resulting in user confusion and unexpected granted permissions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Custom cursor could obscure the permission dialog

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

A malicious website could have used a combination of exiting fullscreen mode and `requestPointerLock` to cause the user's mouse to be re-positioned unexpectedly, which could have led to user confusion and inadvertently granting permissions they did not intend to grant.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Mouse cursor re-positioned unexpectedly could have led to unintended permission grants

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Mouse cursor re-positioned unexpectedly could have led to unintended permission grants

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Set-Cookie response headers were being incorrectly honored in multipart HTTP responses. If an attacker could control the Content-Type response header, as well as control part of the response body, they could inject Set-Cookie response headers that would have been honored by the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Multipart HTTP Responses would accept the Set-Cookie header in response parts
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Incorrect code generation could have led to unexpected numeric conversions and potential undefined behavior. This issue only affects 32-bit ARM devices.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

names: Andrew McCreight and Randell Jesup and Gabriele Svelto and Paul Bone and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 122, Firefox ESR 115.7, and Thunderbird 115.7. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 123, Firefox ESR 115.8, and Thunderbird 115.8
